profile.subtitle: Showing Dharma Deva Features
profile.describe: A son, named Dharma, was born of the heart of Brahm√¢; he was devoted to Brahm√¢jn√¢na (the knowledge of Brahm√¢), truthful, and always engaged in rites and ceremonies and in accordance with the Vedic religion. This high souled Muni Dharma was a householder and married duly, according to the proper procedure, to the ten daughters of Daksa Praj√¢pati. This Dharma, the foremost amongst the followers of truth, impregnated them and had four sons, named respectively Hari, Krisna, Nara, and N√¢r√¢yana. Hari and Krisna, amongst the four, used to remain always in the practising of the yoga. Nara and N√¢r√¢yana came over to the Him√¢lay√¢n mountains and, in the hermitage of Badarik√¢, commenced the difficult religious asceticism and penance.
